title: [BUG] .Net Framework application crash after upgrade to 2.80.1 from 1.68.3
body:
**Description**
After update from 1.68.3 to 2.80.1, application randomly either crash or throw following error: 
Managed Debugging Assistant 'FatalExecutionEngineError' : "'The runtime has encountered a fatal error. The address of the error was at 0x74a40bf1, on thread 0x3bac. The error code is 0xc0000005. This error may be a bug in the CLR or in the unsafe or non-verifiable portions of user code. Common sources of this bug include user marshaling errors for COM-interop or PInvoke, which may corrupt the stack.'

Attached a sample project to reproduce the issue.

The crash/error happens with following configurations:
1. **.Net Framework** project  (framework 4.6.2 - 4.8)
2. In project property dialog (Project property - > Build tab)
- Platform Target set to: **Any CPU**  
- **AND** "Prefer 32-bit" option **CHECKED**


**Code**

Attached a simple sample project to reproduce 
[SkiaSharp Crash Bug.zip](https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/files/4926432/SkiaSharp.Crash.Bug.zip)

**Actual Behavior**

The app randomly either crash or throw error.

**Basic Information**

- Version with issue:  2.80.1
- Last known good version:  1.68.3
- IDE:  Visual Studio 2019

**Screenshots**
 
![Skiasharp2 80 error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/63121477/87568444-46df1400-c68b-11ea-858a-96119c5d88e9.png)

Sample project to reproduce the issue.
